data.title: King Juan Carlos and Queen Sofia reunite for family celebration
data.meta_description: King Juan Carlos and Queen Sofia have come together to celebrate the graduation of their granddaughter, Irene Urdangarin. The eighteen year old, youngest child of Infanta Cristina, has now completed her secondary education. She graduated...
data.text:
King Juan Carlos and Queen Sofia have come together to celebrate the graduation of their granddaughter, Irene Urdangarin.

The eighteen year old, youngest child of Infanta Cristina, has now completed her secondary education.

Embed from Getty Images

She graduated from her school in Geneva in Switzerland with her family, including her grandparents, supporting her.

King Juan Carlos made the journey from his home in Abu Dhabi where he went into self imposed exile in 2020. Queen Sofia still lives in Spain.

Itâ€™s the second time in weeks that Juan Carlos and Sofia have been seen together in past weeks. At the start of June, they attended the wedding of Crown Prince Hussein and Princess Rajwa in Jordan.

Embed from Getty Images

It was also a rare public appearance for Infanta Cristina and Inaki Urdangarin. They separated after he was photographed with another woman as the supervised release period of a prison sentence for embezzlement began.

Irene Urdangarin is the only daughter of Infanta Cristina and Inaki Urdangarin. She was born in June 2005 and is now tenth in line to the throne of Spain.
